law_name: THE INLAND MECHANICALLY PROPELLED VESSELS ACT

sections.section_title: Short title and extent
sections.body: This Act may be called the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act. It extends to the whole of Pakistan.

sections.section_title: Definitions
sections.body: In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, 'mechanically propelled vessel' means every description of vessel ordinarily plying on inland waters and propelled wholly or in part by steam, electricity or other mechanical power, and includes for purposes only of registration under this Act a sailing boat, dumb barge and any other craft not mechanically propelled when towed or pushed by a mechanically propelled vessel; 'inland water' means any canal, river, lake or other navigable water in Pakistan; 'passenger' includes any person carried in a mechanically propelled vessel other than the master and crew and the owner, his family and servants; 'prescribed' means prescribed by any rule under this Act; 'registrar' means a registrar appointed under this Act; 'survey' means the survey of a mechanically propelled vessel under this Act; 'surveyor' means a surveyor appointed under this Act; and 'voyage' includes the plying of a mechanically propelled vessel at or about any place.

sections.section_title: Mechanically propelled vessel not to proceed on voyage or to be used for service without certificate of survey
sections.body: A mechanically propelled vessel shall not proceed on any voyage, or ply on any inland water unless she has a certificate of survey and a certificate of registry, in force and applicable to such voyage or water, and unless she is owned by a person who is a Pakistan national, or by a person registered as a company in Pakistan, or, if registered outside Pakistan, having in Pakistan an agent or branch together with an organisation adequate to the independent operation of the agency or branch within Pakistan.

sections.section_title: Appointment of surveyors and places of survey
sections.body: The Provincial Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare such places, within the territories under its administration, as it thinks fit, to be places of survey and registry, and appoint so many persons to be surveyors and registrar at the said places as it thinks fit, for the purposes of this Act.

sections.section_title: Powers of surveyors
sections.body: For the purposes of a survey or registry, the surveyor or the registrar, as the case may be, may, at any reasonable time, go on board any mechanically propelled vessel, and may inspect the mechanically propelled vessel and every part thereof, including the hull, boilers, engines and other machinery, and all equipments and articles on board.
